body: :+1: for making this behavior configurable via a separate option, even if the default behavior is to keep output buffering enabled.

This new behavior caught me days ago when I was unable to send some text to console from a unit test.
It took me a while to figure out why, so your request seems logical to me. +1

This is the new behaviour:

```
➜  ~  cat TestWithOutput.php 
<?php
class TestWithOutput extends PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testThatPrintsSomething()
    {
        $this->assertTrue(TRUE);
        print 'XXX';
    }
}


➜  ~  phpunit TestWithOutput          
PHPUnit @package_version@ by Sebastian Bergmann.

.XXX

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 3.75Mb

OK (1 test, 0 assertions)


➜  ~  phpunit --strict --verbose TestWithOutput
PHPUnit @package_version@ by Sebastian Bergmann.

FXXX

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 3.75Mb

There was 1 failure:

1) TestWithOutput::testThatPrintsSomething
This test printed output: XXX

FAILURES!
Tests: 1, Assertions: 1, Failures: 1.
```

How about 

```
....F....

Failure: Test produced unexpected output
$yourVarDumpOutput
```

so you don't get a working test suite with debug output leftovers but you can var_dump all you want? Never mind, thats where i was going anyways :) (Just noticed the commit and comment)
Figures; I _just_ finished fixing all the output buffering problems in sfJwtPhpUnitPlugin!  (:

issue.title: Promlems with testing output

body: Is there a way to enable output swallowing with a configuration in phpunit.xml or something ? Thanks

issue.title: Output isn't swallowed, if with @outputBuffering
issue.body:
Issues #420 and #411 aren't completely resolved.

If you leave $this->expectOutputString(), output is _not_ swallowed, even if @outputBuffering is used:

``` php
<?php

class OutputTest extends PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    /**
     * Test without output buffering
     *
     * @outputBuffering enabled
     */

    public function testWithoutOutputBuffering()
    {
        print 'XXX';
        $this->assertEquals( true, true );
    }
}
```

outputs

```
$ phpunit tehst.php
PHPUnit 3.6.10 by Sebastian Bergmann.

Configuration read from /home/jay/public_html/test/phpunit.xml

.XXX

Time: 0 seconds, Memory: 6.00Mb

OK (1 test, 1 assertion)
```
